As President and COO at GoDaddy, my role is to provide both strategic guidance and day-to-day operational excellence for the world’s leading platform for small businesses & organizations to build a great online presence. As COO, I focus on providing leadership to our domains business, our website and customer care channels and building a high performance culture -- fast, flexible, innovative, customer-oriented-- across GoDaddy. At GoDaddy, we’re working to radically shift the global economy toward small businesses by empowering people to easily start, confidently grow and successfully run their own ventures. With more than 13 million business customers worldwide and more than 60 million domain names under management, GoDaddy gives small business owners the tools to name their idea, build a beautiful online presence, attract customers and manage their business. As a senior leader at GoDaddy,a big part of my role is to maintain, represent and build our company culture. GoDaddy is made up of over 5,000 terrific individuals who own outcomes, approach work fearlessly, are transparent and accountable, learn quickly and celebrate both wins and the overall journey of building a distinctive company. At GoDaddy, we constantly seek to improve – both as individuals and as a company -- and to deliver uncommon results for our customers and our investors.

As COO/CFO at GoDaddy, my role is to provide both strategic guidance and day-to-day operational excellence for the world’s leading platform for small businesses & organizations to build a great online presence.  As COO, I focus on providing leadership to our domains business, our website and customer care channels and building a high performance culture -- fast, flexible, innovative, customer-oriented-- across GoDaddy. As a CFO, my focus is linking our company vision and technology strategy to business results and delivering superior value to our customers and our investors, both for the short & long-term.
Member and Head of KKR Capstone North America

KKR is a leading global investment firm and a pioneer in private equity.   At KKR, I was a Member/ Partner at KKR Capstone, a group of operating executives who work exclusively with KKR’s private equity portfolio companies to drive operational improvements that translate into distinctive investment returns.     My work with KKR investment teams and portfolio companies spanned both advisory and interim executive roles, focused on the Technology, Payments, Digital Media, and Services sectors.     These experiences ranged from successful operational turnarounds in highly levered companies to accelerating growth in good businesses and helping make them great.

Led the company through a transition from the founding management team.    Accomplishments include recruiting nearly a dozen sr executives, closing 2 product acquisitions, and making improvements to website operations and customer experience.    Achieved double-digit revenue and customer increases and grew EBITDA at >30% vs. prior year
Ran a ~$500mm division in Enthusiast Media;  led company-wide online efforts and all operations functions such as circulation, finance, production and IT.

recommendations: Andrew is a world-class executive and individual.  I recommend him without hesitation.  He's exceptionally bright, has terrific business instinct and judgment, has a work ethic second to none, and is a great teammate and leader.  He was a very successful executive at KKR and made major contributions to both our portfolio companies and investment approach during his time here.   I have the utmost respect for Andrew as a professional and as a person.   He's genuine, has great personal integrity and is enjoyable to be around -- absolutely someone you want on your team or want to do business with.People should go out of their way to involve Andrew in their businesses.

summary: “There are only two options regarding commitment.  You’re in or out. There is no such thing as life in-between.” Pat Riley. Great quote, even though the 90's Knicks were painful to watchI’ve been described as an all-on and all-in leader, committed to operational excellence, growth mindset and 100% involvement. I enjoy helping people realize their potential and companies maximize their value -- both of which are usually higher than what ‘conventional wisdom’ expects. There’s nothing more rewarding than creating something distinctive and meaningful, particularly when others think or say you can’t do it. I value integrity, hard work, grit, talent, competitive fire and great comedy movies. As COO of GoDaddy I provide leadership for our domain business, website and customer care operations as well as our strategy and finance functions. At GoDaddy, we serve >13mm customers, helping them build a great online presence powered by elegant technology products and personalized customer care. I’m inspired by our customers who are all ‘do’ers’ following their ideas or passions, and by my fellow GoDaddy’ers, who are action oriented, outcome driven, and genuine. I thrive in fast paced, build/fix it environments and learned much of my craft at the global private equity firm KKR, where I was a Partner co-leading the NA portfolio operations team.   At KKR, I learned the value of a) identifying the ~3-4 things that matter to customers and to a business b) driving those 3 things at a detailed level c) building a great team(s) with vibrant, talented people and d) that speed and simplicity win in both business and life.   I live in the Bay Area with my brilliant wife Julianne and my three kids. I love California, but am a Midwestern guy who also believes New York City is the greatest city in the world and nothing else is close. When I’m not working, you can find me involved with one my of kid’s numerous sports & activities.
name: Scott Wagner
title: President, COO at GoDaddy:  Helping Ideas Thrive Online
